APPENDIX A
NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF EDUCATIONAL BROADCASTERS
1346 Connecticut Avenue, N.W.
Washington, D. C. 20036
February 11, 1964
Dear Colleague:
The Research Committee of the National Association of EducaÂ¬
tional Broadcasters needs your assistance.
We want to do two things: (1) build a roster of research work
ers in educational broadcasting and (2) compile a list of
completed studies and current projects.
The need is clear. Researchers in educational broadcasting
have relatively few ways of communicating with each other.
Much of the work that has been done is not circulated through
the usual channels of scholarly publication. Many of the
persons doing the work are not members of N.A.E.B.
The Committee wishes to take a more active part in putting
researchers with common problems in touch with each other on
a continuing basis and to be a clearing house for those who
are seeking research results.
We would appreciate it very much if you would complete the
enclosed questionnaire, including the part that asks you to
help us to discover active researchers in our field who are
not on our initial list.
Thank you! Please use the enclosed envelope to return your
questionnaire to the Washington Office.
For the Committee:
PDH:sc
Enclosures
Presley D. Holmes, Jr
Chairman, Research
Committee
